records.location_details: Evros river, on Border Surveillance / SE operation area.
records.context_note: A dead body was found in the Evros river. An autopsy has been requested by Hellenic Police to identify the reason of death.
records.evidence_quote: Dead body found in Evros river

records.location_details: Ionian Sea, during a SAR operation.
records.context_note: 21 migrants were rescued, 12 dead bodies recovered, and approximately 20 migrants went missing during a SAR operation in the Ionian Sea. The SAR operation was ended on 15.01.2020 with 20 persons still missing.
records.evidence_quote: 21 migrants rescued, 12 dead bodies recovered, approx. 20 migrants missing in SAR operation in Ionian Sea

records.location_details: Aegean Sea, during Poseidon Sea 2019 operation.
records.context_note: A Frontex deployed team member exhibited improper behaviour when interacting with migrants. An investigation is ongoing, with the FRO appointed as SIR coordinator.
records.evidence_quote: Frontex deployed team member - improper behaviour. Improper behaviour when interacting with migrants.

records.context_note: A Congolese man was stabbed in Moria camp on Lesvos Island and subsequently died in hospital. An Afghan national was arrested by Hellenic authorities, and a judicial process is ongoing.
records.evidence_quote: Congolese man stabbed in Moria camp (Lesvos Island) dies in hospital

records.location_details: Moria camp, Lesvos Island, close to the main gate, Greece.
records.location_text_raw: Moria camp Lesvos Island- protest close to main gate
records.context_note: A young migrant was stabbed to death at Moria camp, Lesvos Island, during a protest close to the main gate. Frontex staff abandoned working facilities as a precautionary measure, and public order was later restored by the Hellenic Police.
records.evidence_quote: Young migrant stabbed to death at Moria camp Lesvos Island- protest close to main gate

records.context_note: One migrant was stabbed with a sharp object and injured in RIC Kos/Pyli. Riot Police closed the RIC, and several migrants were arrested. The injured migrant received medical support and was transported to the hospital.
records.evidence_quote: Stabbing in RIC Kos/Pyli. One migrant was stabbed with a sharp object and got injured.

records.location_details: Evros area, on Border Surveillance / SE operation area.
records.context_note: A dead body was found in the Evros area. No travel documents were found. The body was transferred to Alexandroupolis Hospital, and an autopsy has been requested by Hellenic Police.
records.evidence_quote: Dead body found in Evros area.

records.location_details: Aegean Sea, during a patrol mission.
records.context_note: A Frontex crew member was injured during a patrol mission in the Aegean Sea when slipping off stairs while attempting to pull a rubber boat. No significant injury was detected after hospital examination.
records.evidence_quote: one of the crew members, while attempting to pull a rubber boat, slipped off the stairs and injured his right leg knee.

records.location_details: Lesvos Island, near a 'Multifunctional Control Centre' and Karava area, with clashes also at Mantamados area.
records.uncertainty_note: Multiple locations mentioned on Lesvos Island.
records.context_note: A Frontex patrol/surveillance car was blocked by civilian demonstrators on Lesvos Island, near a 'Multifunctional Control Centre' and Karava area. Two crew members were prevented from proceeding, one was pushed, and the vehicle was damaged. Major clashes between police and locals were reported in Mantamados. Frontex staff were advised not to travel to the North part of the Island until the situation normalized.
records.evidence_quote: Riots in Lesvos Island - Frontex patrol/surveillance car blocked by demonstrators

records.location_details: A military restricted zone in Greece (Flexible Operational Activities 2020 Land area).
records.uncertainty_note: Specific location of the military restricted zone is not provided.
records.context_note: Frontex DEU Team Members entered a military restricted zone while off duty. They were immediately suspended from Frontex operational activities in the area and will be possibly redeployed to another operational area outside of Greece.
records.evidence_quote: Incident involving Frontex DEU Team Members entering a military restricted zone while off duty

records.context_note: A Frontex deployed officers' car was stopped and damaged by demonstrators at Chios RIC Vial. Personnel from Frontex, EASO, and Europol were prevented from leaving and had to be escorted by Hellenic Police. No physical harm was inflicted, but officers were physiologically affected. The rented car was damaged. Hellenic Police decided to suspend professional activities at RIC Vial until safety conditions normalized.
records.evidence_quote: Frontex deployed officers car stopped and damaged by demonstrators in Chios RIC Vial

records.location_details: Evros area, on Border Surveillance / SE operation area.
records.context_note: A dead body was found in the Evros area. An autopsy has been requested by Hellenic Police to identify the reason of death.
records.evidence_quote: Dead body found in Evros area

records.location_details: Aegean Sea (implied by 'Rapid Border Intervention Aegean 2020').
records.context_note: A Frontex fixed-wing aircraft was intercepted by two Turkish Airforce F-16 fighters. No additional information on subsequent measures or actions taken by involved actors is available.
records.evidence_quote: Fixed Wing Aircraft intercepted by 2 Turkish Airforce fighters F-16

records.location_details: Land operation area (JO FOA Land 2020), Greece.
records.uncertainty_note: Specific location within Greece is not provided.
records.context_note: A Hellenic Police Officer tested positive for COVID-19. The officer was never paired or in contact with other crew members. The SIR is closed.
records.evidence_quote: One Hellenic Police Officer positive to COVID-19 test

records.context_note: Alleged suicide of a migrant in RIC Moria, Lesvos Island. The incident occurred on 26.03.2020, but it was not confirmed if it was actually a suicide. Hellenic authorities ordered an autopsy.
records.evidence_quote: Alleged suicide of a migrant in RIC Moria - Lesvos Island

records.location_details: Olive grove opposite the North gate of RIC Moria, Lesvos Island, Greece.
records.where_clear: Olive grove near RIC Moria, Lesvos Island, Greece
records.location_text_raw: olive grove opposite to the North gate of RIC Moria
records.context_note: A migrant was stabbed at an olive grove opposite the North gate of RIC Moria, Lesvos Island, and died after being transferred to the hospital. The Hellenic Police are investigating to find the perpetrator.
records.evidence_quote: Dead migrant at RIC Moria - Lesvos Island, after stabbing.

records.location_details: Frontex containers in RIC Vial, Chios Island, damaged following a riot in RIC Moria, Lesvos Island, Greece.
records.uncertainty_note: The SIR title refers to damages in RIC Vial (Chios), but the detailed description of the riot and fires explicitly states 'in RIC Moria'. The death that triggered the riot occurred in Moria.
records.context_note: Frontex containers in RIC Vial (Chios) were damaged following a riot. The riot, which involved fires in the asylum service office and canteen, and a stone fight with Hellenic police, occurred in RIC Moria. It was triggered by the death of a 49-year-old Iraqi woman, believed by rioters to be from COVID-19 (test negative). Frontex staff were withdrawn from RIC Vial due to safety concerns.
records.evidence_quote: Damages of Frontex containers inside RIC Vial (Chios) following a riot. On 18.04.2020, in the evening, fires broke in the office of the asylum service and as well in the canteen, in RIC Moria.

records.location_details: Near Kos Island, Greece, in the context of JO Poseidon 2020.
records.context_note: A Danish Coastal Patrol Boat (Frontex deployed asset) intercepted a migrant boat near Kos Island. Greek authorities ordered a push-back to Turkish Territorial Waters, but the CPB Commanding Officer refused due to concerns about the order being risky and not in line with operational procedures. The 33 rescued migrants were subsequently disembarked at Kos Port and handed over to the Hellenic Coast Guard. The incident was addressed with Hellenic authorities, emphasizing adherence to operational plans and fundamental rights.
records.evidence_quote: The crew of the CPB was informed by the Hellenic Liaison Officer on-board about an order issued by the Greek authorities to transfer the migrants back to the rigid boat and escort it back into the Turkish Territorial Waters.
